intro: Psittacanthus sonorae, commonly known as the Sonoran velvetleaf, is a perennial shrub native to the arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
